intro: Hymenasplenium distans, commonly known as the narrow-leaf water starwort, is a small aquatic plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It typically grows in slow-moving freshwater environments such as ponds and streams. The plant has slender, branching stems that are often submerged, with small, opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are clustered in dense, spike-like inflorescences, and they are usually greenish-white in color. Hymenasplenium distans plays a role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various invertebrates.
